paper_summary.description: Legacy single-query summary (deprecated, use structured summary instead)
paper_summary.template:
You are summarizing an AI paper. Produce a concise markdown summary with:
- What it does concretely as a logical chain of steps, plain language, no figurative speech.
- The main area it benefits (model performance / training efficiency / inference throughput / etc.).
- The rationale behind this benefit.
- Quantifiable results in the main area it improves.
- No duplication across the above.

extract_components.description: Extract key components/concepts from a paper
extract_components.template:
You are analyzing an AI research paper. Identify the key technical components, methods, or concepts introduced or used in this paper.

For example, DeepSeek-V3 has: MLA (Multi-head Latent Attention), MTP (Multi-Token Prediction), fine-grained FP8 training, DualPipe parallelism.

Rules:
- List only distinct technical contributions or methods
- Use the abbreviation if well-known (e.g., "MLA" not "Multi-head Latent Attention")
- Include 1-5 components (fewer for simple papers, more for comprehensive ones)
- Each component should be a specific technique, not a general concept

Respond with a JSON array of component names, e.g.: ["MLA", "MTP", "FP8 Training", "DualPipe"]
If the paper has only one main contribution, return a single-element array.
Respond with ONLY the JSON array, nothing else.

component_steps.description: Describe the logical steps or pseudo-code for a component
component_steps.template:
Describe the logical chain of steps or pseudo-code for the following component/method from the paper.

Component: {component}

Rules:
- Use plain language, no figurative speech
- Be concrete and specific
- Use numbered steps or pseudo-code format
- Keep it concise (3-7 steps typically)

Respond with the steps only, no preamble.

component_benefits.description: Identify the main area a component benefits
component_benefits.template:
What is the main area that the following component/method benefits?

Component: {component}

Choose from categories like:
- Model performance (accuracy, quality)
- Training efficiency (speed, memory, cost)
- Inference throughput (latency, tokens/sec)
- Scalability (larger models, more data)
- Other (specify)

Respond with a brief answer (1-2 sentences), stating the benefit area and a short explanation.

component_rationale.description: Explain the rationale behind a component's benefit
component_rationale.template:
Explain WHY the following component/method provides its benefits. What is the underlying insight or mechanism?

Component: {component}

Rules:
- Focus on the 'why' not the 'what'
- Be technical but accessible
- 2-4 sentences

Respond with the rationale only, no preamble.

component_results.description: Extract quantifiable results for a component
component_results.template:
What are the quantifiable results or metrics reported for the following component/method?

Component: {component}

Rules:
- Include specific numbers, percentages, or comparisons
- If no specific metrics for this component, state 'No specific metrics reported'
- Be concise (1-3 bullet points)

Respond with the results only, no preamble.

node_naming.description: Generate a distinguishing name for a tree node based on its children and siblings
node_naming.template:
You are naming a category node in a research paper taxonomy tree.

Given the summaries/names of children nodes under this category, and the summaries/names of sibling categories (other categories at the same level), generate a concise, descriptive name (2-5 words) that:
1. Captures what distinguishes this group of children from the siblings
2. Is specific enough to be meaningful
3. Uses standard AI research terminology when possible

Children under this category:
{children_summaries}

Sibling categories (for contrast):
{sibling_summaries}

Respond with ONLY the category name (2-5 words), nothing else. Do not include explanations, punctuation, or quotes.

classify.description: Classify a paper into a category
classify.template:
You are a research paper classifier. Given a paper's title and abstract, determine the most appropriate category for it.

Primary AI research categories:
- Model Architecture (transformer variants, attention mechanisms, novel neural network designs)
- Training Efficiency (optimization, distributed training, memory efficiency)
- Inference Optimization (quantization, pruning, distillation, serving)
- Reinforcement Learning (RL algorithms, RLHF, reward modeling)
- Vision (image classification, object detection, segmentation, generation)
- Speech (ASR, TTS, audio processing)
- Natural Language Processing (text understanding, generation, translation)
- Multimodal (vision-language, audio-visual, cross-modal)
- Datasets & Benchmarks (new datasets, evaluation frameworks)
- Applications (specific use cases, deployments)

Existing categories in the tree: {existing_categories}

Instructions:
1. If the paper fits well into an existing category, use that exact category name.
2. If it doesn't fit existing categories, suggest the most appropriate category from the primary list.
3. If it's a very specific sub-topic and there are already many papers in a category, suggest a more specific sub-category.

Paper Title: {title}

Paper Abstract: {abstract}

Respond with ONLY the category name, nothing else. Do not include explanations or punctuation.

abbreviate.description: Generate a short abbreviation for a paper title
abbreviate.template:
Generate a short, memorable abbreviation for this research paper title.

Rules:
- Use the well-known abbreviation if one exists (e.g., "GPT-4", "BERT", "ViT", "CLIP")
- If no well-known abbreviation exists, create a short one (max 15 chars)
- Use acronyms, key terms, or author-style names (e.g., "DeepSeek-R1", "DAPO", "LLaMA")
- ALWAYS preserve version numbers exactly as written (e.g., "V3", "V3.1", "v2", "4o") to distinguish between different versions
- For technical reports, include the model name and version (e.g., "DeepSeek-V3" not just "DeepSeek")

Paper title: {title}

Respond with ONLY the abbreviation, nothing else.

explain_reference.description: Explain how a cited paper relates to the source paper

merge_qa_to_summary.description: Merge Q&A content into existing summary sections
merge_qa_to_summary.template:
You are merging Q&A content into an existing paper summary.

Current Summary:
{current_summary}

New Q&A to integrate:
{qa_content}

Instructions:
1. Read the current summary structure carefully
2. For each Q&A pair, identify where the information best fits in the summary
3. Integrate the new information naturally into the relevant sections
4. If information already exists, enhance it with additional details from Q&A
5. If information is truly new, add it to the most relevant section
6. Preserve the overall structure and formatting of the summary
7. Do NOT add duplicate information

Respond with the updated summary only, maintaining the same markdown format.

dedup_summary.description: Remove duplicated content from a summary
dedup_summary.template:
You are cleaning up a paper summary to remove duplicated content.

Current Summary:
{summary}

Instructions:
1. Identify any duplicated or redundant information across sections
2. Keep the most detailed/accurate version of duplicated content
3. Remove the less detailed duplicates
4. Merge related points that are scattered across sections
5. Preserve the overall structure and formatting
6. Ensure each piece of information appears only once in the most relevant section

Respond with the deduplicated summary only, maintaining the same markdown format. If no duplicates found, return the summary unchanged.
